hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Overreaction Fade in Memecoins
hypothesis_content.statement: For high-beta, news-sensitive approved memecoins (DOGE, PEPE, TRUMP), a price move exceeding ±15% within 2 hours following a major news headline (categorized by NLP sentiment) will partially revert within the next 6 hours. Fading 50% of the initial move yields a positive expectancy when the broader regime is NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, sustained trends are less common. Memecoins are highly retail-driven and prone to overreaction on news. The initial spike often exhausts liquidity, leading to a sharp retracement as early buyers take profits and the emotional reaction cools.
entry_conditions: Asset in approved memecoin list (DOGE, PEPE, TRUMP)
News sentiment score (NLP) is extreme (>0.7 or <-0.7)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2-hour news-driven move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues an additional 25% in the initial move's direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The initial news-driven move continues in the same direction past the 6-hour window in the majority of cases, indicating the news has fundamental, lasting impact rather than causing a transient overreaction.
